title: Can't add outlook.com email or a google based email
content: I've been using TB for years. Recently, I uninstalled it to try other mail clients. I decided to get TB working again but I'm incredibly frustrated that I'm unable to get an outlook.com account and my nexamortgage.com account working. The NEXA account is google based and is usually quite easy. I also have a Keller Williams account that is also Google based and that worked fine on TB just before I tried to setup my NEXA account. I have tried to enter both manually and have tried multiple different IMAP, SMTP Port settings and Server settings, but nothing is working.
creator: chunnel

title: Profile transfer not working after accidental delete of all emails
content:
Hi, I am extremely frustrated at my situation: I have a desktop (main computer), laptop and mobile phone all using Thunderbird, with a GMAIL account (IMAP) On my laptop I accidentally deleted the contents of the Archive (Thunderbird folder) and promptly ALL EMAILS AND HISTORY of emails wer LOST on said laptop. They subsequently disappeared on my mobile phone also. The delete action was also uploaded to GMAIL.com and I could not recover them there as it said I am using a different program. I then went on my desktop in offline mode and all my emails are there in Thunderbird (minus approx 5 days worth while the desktop remained offline (no big deal).

I have tried EVERYTHING to back up/export the profile from my desktop (while offline) and upload the mails onto my laptop to recover them and hopefully feed them to GMAIL. Nothing happens, they do not appear. I see all my emails within the thunderbird profile folder in a "IMAP.GMAIL.COM" folder but not in a "Mail" folder (is that relevant)? Is the laptop loading the emails then immediately deleting them, because it is syncing with GMAIL? I am so so lost. Please help. Thank you
creator: petgroom

title: Replying/sending with one emails no longer works
content: I think after an update one of my emails no longer received or would send. The webmail for the account still worked and no change on the account. I use Thunderbird because I can see and read multiple email accounts on one page in the one program. I decided to put into Thunderbird the same email account with the correct password. I removed connections for the old account but still left all the past emails in the inbox. The new account receives emails but I can not reply or send out. To reply I have to change email accounts which is confusing for the receiver and also replies are in the wrong sent box. It used to be easy to adjust the settings including passwords words (which one my need to do frequently). Can someone tell be how I can fix the settings for outgoing emails. I have at present 3 email accounts with the service provider Telstra and 3 gmail accounts (the latter are OK at present)
creator: pbenken

title: Copying Thunderbird .eml messages to a USB drive
content:
Hello from France,

Copying Thunderbird .eml messages to a USB drive formatted as FAT32

ASUS PC, Windows 11

Directly copying a Thunderbird message via "More" > "Save As" to the USB drive works normally.

However, if I try to copy the same message that was previously copied to any folder on my ASUS Windows 11 PC, I get an error message that says:

“This file has properties that cannot be copied to the new location “

Please help me resolve this issue.

Have a good day.

title: Thunderbird "Forgot" email Password
content: Overnight, while computer was sleeping, Thunderbird appears to have forgotten the email password. A dialog box pops up when checking email "login to server pop.centurylink.net with username {correct email address displayed} failed." With options retry, enter new password, and cancel available. Retry simply loops back to this error. Entering the (verified) correct password has no positive impact at all. Program and computer rebooted, no change. Windows 11 Pro. Password was not recently changed.
creator: paulandtara

title: This forum is incredibly bad!
content:
As the title suggests, I find this forum incredibly bad. It's so difficult to even get to the point where I'm able to post a question, I assume that most who search for help give up and browse for a different forum to get help.

Speaking of other forums - I'm not sure if this is supposed to be the official place to get help if you have problems with your Thunderbird install. There is also this one, but that seems to be strictly a place for developers? Or is that for users reporting bugs too? If that other forum is for developers, then my next question would be if Thunderbird developers even read about posted bugs in this forum? If not, then what's the point of this anyways?

In short, I would like to know if this right here is indeed supposed to be the "official" place for Thunderbird users to report bugs and make suggestions or should this be done somewhere else. Just the fact that I as a user can't tell already says a lot.

Please Mozilla or Thunderbird - shut this down and create a better forum for your users! For example, other software that I use has discourse forums that work very well for connecting users and developers. If you can create a better place for your user base to come together, report bugs, make suggestions and give feedback, you make the whole experience around using Thunderbird more enjoyable and ultimately gain more users.

Thank you for your work on Thunderbird.
creator: RumpelKnabe

title: Two things are broken
content: 1. I am getting Mozilla Thunderbird ESR notices pop up when I log on to my PC (W11). I checked my Thunderbird version and I have 146.0.1 and I am on the release channel so why am I getting these notices ? 2. Recently I noticed that when I try to move e-mail messages to a specific folder, I right click on the message and get the prompt Move To and then Recent Destinations where the problem exists. The list of Recent Destinations used to be in alphabetical order and now it is sorted by most recent destination time. This slows me down considerably. Please revert. Thanks !!
creator: romcinsam

title: Zoeken op meerdere maar niet aangesloten termen; geen fuzzy search
content:
Ik wil in mails zoeken op meerdere, niet aaneengesloten termen. Bijvoorbeeld alle mails waarin zowel "Jan" als "operations" allebei voorkomen, maar niet naast elkaar. Ik wil geen mails in het zoekresultaat waar maar één van beide in voorkomt.

TB geeft ook treffers met woorden die lijken op mijn zoekcriteria, ik krijg bijvoorbeeld ook mails met het woord "operator" erin. Maar die wil ik niet.

Als ik dit zo lees, dan is wat ik wil niet mogelijk. Verder lijkt het erop lijkt het erop dat plugins niet meer werken met TB versie 146.0.x. Global Search uitzetten zodat DuckDuckGo als search engine overblijft levert ook niet het gewenste effect.

Vraag ik iets onmogelijks?
